parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "partition": "octopus",
    "nodes": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 64,
    "mem_per_cpu": "5000M",
    "mail_type": "BEGIN,END",
    "mail_user": "alex.lepauvre@ae.mpg.de",
    "time": "200:00:00",
    "output": "/mnt/beegfs/XNAT/COGITATE/ECoG/phase_2/processed/bids/derivatives/activation_analysis/slurm-duration_decoding-%A_%a.out",
    "job_name": "duration_decoding",
    "conda_env": "/hpc/users/$USER/.conda/envs/mne_ecog02",
    "python_script": "./Experiment1ActivationAnalysis/duration_decoding_master.py"
  }
}
```

**Explanation:**

* **Application:** The script uses SLURM (Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management) to manage and execute the job. This is indicated by the `#SBATCH` directives at the beginning. 
* **Details:** The script provides various details about the SLURM configuration and other software/resources used:
    * **Partition:** The job is run on the "octopus" partition of the cluster. 
    * **Nodes:**  The job requires 1 node.
    * **CPUs per task:**  The job uses 64 CPUs per task.
    * **Memory per CPU:**  The job requires 5000 MB of memory per CPU. 
    * **Mail type:**  The user will receive email notifications at the start and end of the job.
    * **Mail user:**  The email address for notifications is `alex.lepauvre@ae.mpg.de`.
    * **Time:**  The job has a maximum time limit of 200 hours. 
    * **Output:**  The output of the job will be stored in `/mnt/beegfs/XNAT/COGITATE/ECoG/phase_2/processed/bids/derivatives/activation_analysis/slurm-duration_decoding-%A_%a.out`.
    * **Job name:**  The job name is "duration_decoding".
    * **Conda environment:** The script uses a conda environment named "mne_ecog02".
    * **Python script:** The script runs a Python file called "duration_decoding_master.py" from the "./Experiment1ActivationAnalysis" directory.
